channel.title: Comedy Central’s Hell Of A Week with Charlamagne Tha God
channel.description: Charlamagne Tha God invites unlikely pairings of comedians, outspoken celebrities, and thought-leaders across the political spectrum to debate the current events permeating politics and culture. With each week on fire, this weekly late-night show will feature influential guests unpacking the stories blazing the headlines. Comedy Central’s Hell Of A Week with Charlamagne Tha God is the week's last laugh. Hear full episodes of Comedy Central’s Hell of a Week with Charlamagne Tha God adapted for audio every Friday.
channel.itunes:summary: Charlamagne Tha God invites unlikely pairings of comedians, outspoken celebrities, and thought-leaders across the political spectrum to debate the current events permeating politics and culture. With each week on fire, this weekly late-night show will feature influential guests unpacking the stories blazing the headlines. Comedy Central’s Hell Of A Week with Charlamagne Tha God is the week's last laugh. Hear full episodes of Comedy Central’s Hell of a Week with Charlamagne Tha God adapted for audio every Friday.

item.title: It’s the Economy Stoopid!
item.itunes:title: It’s the Economy Stoopid!
item.description:

item.itunes:title: A Flag on the Play
item.description:

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.itunes:author: Comedy Central and The Black Effect

item.title: Law & Disorder
item.itunes:title: Law & Disorder
item.description:
Charlamagne congratulates Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson on her appointment to the Supreme Court in this episode of Tha God's Honest Truth. But in the midst of celebrating history in the making, Charlamagne also calls bs on the Minnesota prosecutor’s decision to not file charges against the officer who fatally shot Amir Locke. Charlamagne also takes on Tennessee Rep Tom Leatherwood’s Common Law Bill and Oklahoma's ban on abortion.

 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.description:

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Cordae on From A Bird's-Eye-View [Extended Content]
item.itunes:title: Cordae on From A Bird's-Eye-View [Extended Content]
item.description:
What would Cordae like to hear God say when he meets him or her? Find out as he sits down with Lenard "Charlamagne Tha God" McKelvey. They discuss all the ways Cordae invests in the community through work with HBCUs, financial literacy, and philanthropy. Then hear how Cordae channeled the late Steve Jobs when introducing his new album, 'From A Bird's-Eye-View.'

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.content:encoded:

item.itunes:title: Jesus Versuz Santa
item.description:

item.title: Nobody Wins When The Family Feuds
item.itunes:title: Nobody Wins When The Family Feuds
item.description:
Charlamagne Tha God explores the difficulty of interacting with relatives whom you don't particularly enjoy during the holidays, singer/actress Chlöe Bailey stops by, comedians Karlous Miller, Rosebud Baker and therapist Nedra Glover Tawwab join in on the conversation.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:title: The Rittenhouse That Kyle Built
item.description:

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.title: Is Capitalism CAP?
item.itunes:title: Is Capitalism CAP?
item.description:
Charlamagne asks the question is American Capitalism only sustainable for the 1%. Plus God's Honest Tribe member Chico Bean chats with Dr. Claud Anderson about Black Capitalism and generational wealth. Kevin Hart also stops by to talk about his new series “True Story.” And Ian Dunlap joins the conversation to talk about financial literacy.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: Ed Sheeran [Extended Interview]
item.itunes:title: Ed Sheeran [Extended Interview]
item.description:
This week Ed Sheeran drops by Club Reparations to catch up with Charlamagne about what has changed in his life and work since the birth of his daughter and the loss of a very close friend. They break down Ed's new album, Equals, and what may be next for Sheeran beyond his music. 

 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.content:encoded:

item.itunes:author: Comedy Central and The Black Effect

item.title: American Fake-Triotism
item.itunes:title: American Fake-Triotism
item.description:
Charlamagne Tha God challenges America's support for its veterans as rates of homelessness and police brutality against Black service members rise, singer-songwriter Ed Sheeran discusses his album "=," and rapper Soulja Boy stops by.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.title: Nuffin Season
item.itunes:title: Nuffin Season
item.description:
As Charlamagne Tha God explores the idea of modern relationships in Western society, author and relationship expert Shan Boodram and academic scholar Reverend Michael Eric Dyson discuss traditional relationships versus alternative relationships.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.

item.itunes:author: Comedy Central and The Black Effect

item.title: The Tale Of The Cowardly Donkeys
item.itunes:title: The Tale Of The Cowardly Donkeys
item.description:
Charlamagne Tha God explores why Democrats are afraid to act against the GOP and help Black America, then talks with POTUS senior advisor Cedric Richmond and The LOX about saving democracy.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.content:encoded:

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Comedy Central and The Black Effect

item.title: The Digital Devil
item.itunes:title: The Digital Devil
item.description:
In this episode of Tha God's Honest Truth, Charlamagne tries to save humanity from social media hell. In a society that runs on likes, shares, and retweets Charlamagne exposes the corruption of social media and why it needs to be regulated. Charlamagne also talks with Cal Newport (Author: "Digital Minimalism") and Tristan Harris (Co-founder: Center for Humane Technology) to discuss the dangers of the platforms and why we need to detach.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.content:encoded:
In this episode of Tha God's Honest Truth, Charlamagne tries to save humanity from social media hell. In a society that runs on likes, shares, and retweets Charlamagne exposes the corruption of social media and why it needs to be regulated. Charlamagne also talks with Cal Newport (Author: "Digital Minimalism") and Tristan Harris (Co-founder: Center for Humane Technology) to discuss the dangers of the platforms and why we need to detach.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Comedy Central and The Black Effect

item.title: Mental Health: Keep That Same Healing Energy
item.itunes:title: Mental Health: Keep That Same Healing Energy
item.description:
For generations, the black community has identified its trauma as part of “the culture.” In this episode, Charlamagne aims to stop the normalization of trauma in the black community and start a path to healing. We unpack the different ways that black people have had to use unhealthy coping mechanisms to get through their collective PTSD. And we begin the process of learning healthier alternatives of overcoming our pain such as therapy. And by doing so Charlamagne speaks with Dr. Rheeda Walker and Resmaa Menakem to gain insight on how to manage our mental wellness. We'll also be joined by the great Michelle Williams of Destiny's Child who has a podcast centered around mental health called Checking In With Michelle Williams. It’s time to destigmatize mental health in the black community and normalize a healthier future for generations to come.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.content:encoded:
For generations, the black community has identified its trauma as part of “the culture.” In this episode, Charlamagne aims to stop the normalization of trauma in the black community and start a path to healing. We unpack the different ways that black people have had to use unhealthy coping mechanisms to get through their collective PTSD. And we begin the process of learning healthier alternatives of overcoming our pain such as therapy. And by doing so Charlamagne speaks with Dr. Rheeda Walker and Resmaa Menakem to gain insight on how to manage our mental wellness. We'll also be joined by the great Michelle Williams of Destiny's Child who has a podcast centered around mental health called Checking In With Michelle Williams. It’s time to destigmatize mental health in the black community and normalize a healthier future for generations to come.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.itunes:author: Comedy Central and The Black Effect

item.title: CRITICAL RACIST THEORY
item.itunes:title: CRITICAL RACIST THEORY
item.description:
Charlamagne sidelines the buzzy, fear-mongering around utilizing Critical Race Theory in schools to get to the root of conservative pushback. Here we’ll examine the demonstrative power that comes with being black and educated in this country, and we’ll see how young HBCU students handle a lesson in Critical Racist Theory, a sugarcoated account of the past that erases black struggle and conflict from the narrative for white comfort. 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.content:encoded:
Charlamagne sidelines the buzzy, fear-mongering around utilizing Critical Race Theory in schools to get to the root of conservative pushback. Here we’ll examine the demonstrative power that comes with being black and educated in this country, and we’ll see how young HBCU students handle a lesson in Critical Racist Theory, a sugarcoated account of the past that erases black struggle and conflict from the narrative for white comfort. 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

item.itunes:author: Comedy Central and The Black Effect

item.title: ONLY THE FEDS I FEAR
item.itunes:title: ONLY THE FEDS I FEAR
item.description:
Charlamagne puts the entire Federal Bureau of Investigations under investigation. Plus, Charlamagne makes a case for completely removing one man’s name, J. Edgar Hoover, from the FBI building while also holding a competition to see who was American history’s top racist.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.content:encoded:

item.itunes:author: Comedy Central and The Black Effect

item.title: "DECRACKERFICATION"
item.itunes:title: "DECRACKERFICATION"
item.description:
In this episode, Charlamagne looks back on the process of denazification and its effects on Germany while teaching our viewers how to decrackerfy America one institution at a time. We’re not telling you what to do, but we are planting the seed of what can be done.

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
item.content:encoded:

item.itunes:author: Comedy Central and The Black Effect

item.title: Introducing Tha God's Honest Truth with Charlamnge Tha God
item.itunes:title: Introducing Tha God's Honest Truth with Charlamnge Tha God
item.description:
Lenard "Charlamagne Tha God" McKelvey cuts through the bullshit so you don’t step in it. Each episode features a variety of deep dives, sketches, and social experiments that tackle social issues and pressing topics that permeate throughout politics and culture. 

Learn more about your ad-choices at https://www.iheartpodcastnetwork.com

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
